docs.lead_paragraph: A kidney transplant received by Gary Coleman, the 14-year-old star of the NBC-TV show ''Diff'rent Strokes'', is beginning to be rejected by his body and he is undergoing a new kind of dialysis treatment, the National Kidney Foundation announced in New York yesterday. The young actor, who is the foundation's ''gift of life chairman'' and one of its chief TV spokesmen, is only 3 feet 10 inches tall because of a growth-stunting effect of some of the drugs he had to take to sustain the kidney transplant.

headline.main: Gary Coleman Starts New Dialysis Treatment
